p:
In the context of climate change, the vulnerable populations who cannot give or refuse consent would include future generations, and also individuals and nations with little or no political power. Rejecting the idea that the benefits to others can justify the harms to the vulnerable, the Declaration continues:
Medical research involving a disadvantaged or vulnerable population or community is only justified if the project is responsive to the needs and priorities of this population or community and if there is a reasonable likelihood that this population or community stands to benefit from the results of the research. (World Medical Association 2008)
